GlooKit.GlooAPI

Class GlooCore

  • java.lang.Object
    • GlooKit.GlooAPI.GlooCore

  • public class GlooCore
extends java.lang.Object
    All drawing calls pass through here at some point in time. GlooCore's main feature is a BatchQueue, which is basically a glorified arraylist of batches
    See Also:
    Currently, GlooCore only has one window, which limits us to one application running at a time GlooCore is, however, capable of multithreading. Given that a batch is threadable, it automatically threads drawing elements of the batch. Author: Duncan Walter Documenter: Eli Jergensen

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  GlooCore.BatchQueue
      The BatchQueue is specific to the GlooCore (GlooSockets don't have them) The BatchQueue is basically a list of batches, but it also has a specific iterator, which allows it to do pass off batches to different threads without them conflicting with each other Author: Duncan Walter Documenter: Eli Jergensen

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(GlooApplication app)

      • renderFrame

        public void renderFrame(int w,
                        int h)
        This renderFrame call is essentially the main draw call for the entire program. It cycles through all of the batches in the batchQueue and calls render on each see GlooKit.GlooAPI.GlooBatch.Batch#render() Each of the batches is responsible for rendering itself in its entirety Once the batches are all rendered, the buffers are swapped and the batchQueue reset
